text: Yann Randrianasolo (born 3 February 1994) is a French athlete specialising in the long jump. He won a silver medal at the 2019 Summer Universiade. A year earlier he won a bronze at the 2018 Mediterranean Games. His personal bests in the event are 8.08 metres outdoors (+1.4 m/s, Austin 2019) and 7.94 metres indoors (Columbia 2019). ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=3|2018 |Mediterranean Games |Tarragona, Spain |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |Long jump |7.90 m |- |World Cup |London, United Kingdom |7th |Long jump |7.68 m |- |European Championships |Berlin, Germany |28th (q) |Long jump |7.33 m |- |2019 |Universiade |Naples, Italy |bgcolor=silver|2nd |Long jump |7.95 m |} ==References== Category:1994 births Category:Living people Category:French male long jumpers Category:French expatriate sportspeople in the United States Category:South Carolina Gamecocks men's track and field athletes Category:Mediterranean Games medalists in athletics Category:Universiade silver medalists for France Category:Universiade medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Medalists at the 2019 Summer Universiade
title: Yann Randrianasolo
